page.title: 01Laverstock and Clarendon.
page.content: This block lies to the East of the City of Salisbury. It is made up almost entirely of farmland and downland. 91% of the area is privately owned by the{Clarendon Estate,}which has 3 tenanted farms on this block. As well the Estate has{the ruined remains {of the Royal Palace of Clarendon,}the favourite hunting, leisure residence of a number of English monachs from the 12c.to the end of the 16c. Only a small part of the village of Laverstock lies within the area - less than 5%. A further 2% is available for industry serving Salisbury city and Wiltshire,by the A36. A remaining 2% comprises of modern individual homes with plenty of land per plot which are typical of the successful buisness man whose work is in the city. A railway and main trunk road touch the south west corner linking to Southampton.
